attributes.action: Inverness hospital to have free tv & internet access for kids
attributes.additional_details:
It's hard going for children who have long stays in hospital and there doesn't seem to be any real reason why they shouldn't be able to access the internet and be able to pass endless hours why going threw treatment.

Thank you for taking the time to read this 

Kevin
attributes.background:
After spending 10 months in Glasgow children's hospital with our son Riley.who was diagnosed with leukaemia on the 1st of Dec 2016.


Kevin

rejection.details:
We can’t accept your petition because hospitals in Scotland are the responsibility of the Scottish Government, not the UK Government. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

If you haven’t already, you might want to contact your MSP about this issue. You can find out who your MSP is here:  http://www.parliament.scot/msps.aspx

You could also contact NHS Highland about the wifi and internet access at the hospital in Inverness. You can find out how to do that here: http://www.nhshighland.scot.nhs.uk/Feedback/Pages/welcome.aspx

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. You can get in contact with them at petitions@scottish.parliament.uk.
